Key Match Events: The Spurs cut Oklahoma City's lead to 82-75 in the fourth quarter before the Thunder went on a 9-2 run with Gilgeous-Alexander on the bench to regain control of the game.
Rookie Ajay Mitchell scored five points during that stretch.
Post-Match Reflections: Gilgeous-Alexander, one of the league's top scorers with 28.7 points per game through his first three contests, made just 7 of 20 shots, including 2 of 10 from 3.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Victor Wembanyama was held to six points on 1-for-5 shooting in his matchup with Holmgren, a fellow second-year big man.
Wembanyama also had eight rebounds and three blocks.
The Thunder made 17 of 41 3-pointers while the Spurs made 12 of 36.
